result.execSummary:
The defendant Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay all financial obligations for Ct 2 directly to Clerk of Courts. Court waives financial obligations for Ct 1.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not have any contact with the Victim. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman. Jan Lombardi appeared by phone. Jan Lombardi heard. Attorney Stroud questions Mr. Lombardi. Per agreement, State moves to amend Ct 1to misdemeanor battery and Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct. Defendant will be pleading to to amended charges. State will recommend 2 years probation with conditions not to have any contact with the victim, pay court costs, DNA, counseling, and 30 days in jail. Court grants amendment. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Stroud heard. Character testimony given: BO, EJ, AG, AH. Attorney Stroud reads character testimony from CB. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation for each count, consecutive to 20CF229. Conditions of probation are no contact with Victim, pay court costs on Ct 2, costs for Ct 1 are waived, provide DNA sample, and to have such assessment treatment and counseling that DOC deems appropriate.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III in court for Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman. Kyle Sperfslage sworn and testified. Cross. Exhibit #1- offered and accepted. Redirect. Attorney Pozorksi heard and requests bind over. Attorney Stroud heard and objects to bind over. Court heard and binds matter over. DA will wait to file information. Court sets arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stroud appeared in appear in court for the defendant. Attorney Stroud says he has been retained. Defendant is in custody on a P&P hold. Attorney Stroud would like to waive preliminary limits and requests a June hearing date. Court heard and finds good cause to waive prelim time limits but does not want it pushed out that far. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Westley Nickolas Lavern Hoffman appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is currently employed. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests a signature bond with a no contact with Victim #1. Court orders $1000 signature bond with a condition not to have any contact with Victim #1. Status date set.
Defendant shall not have any contact with G.J.
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
